content: I've been thinking about that, and I think my favorite synth-pop album is probably "Violator" by Depeche Mode. There's just something about the way the album balances catchy hooks with darker, more introspective lyrics that really resonates with me. And songs like "Personal Jesus" and "Enjoy the Silence" are just iconic. But I've also been listening to a lot of Eurythmics lately, and their album "Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This)" is another favorite of mine. Annie Lennox's voice is just incredible, and the way they blended synth-pop with other genres like rock and R&B was really innovative for the time. What about you - do you have any favorite synth-pop albums or songs that you always come back to?
